Key Match Events: Yoshinobu Yamamoto pitched five brilliant innings and allowed two hits over five innings with one walk and two strikeouts.
Yu Darvish pitched well across 6â…” innings but gave up solo home runs to Enrique Hernandez and Teoscar Hernandez.
Teoscar Hernandez launched a 420-foot (128-meter) blast into the left field seats in the seventh inning.
The Padres failed to score a run in the last 24 innings of the series.
Post-Match Reflections: Dodgers manager Dave Roberts expressed confidence in Yoshinobu Yamamoto and looked forward to riding him through the World Series.
Shohei Ohtani, a Japanese superstar, will have a chance to battle for a World Series berth.
San Diego Padres manager Mike Shildt praised Yu Darvish's performance but noted the team's struggles.
